Posted By: Bob C
Joe,

posts.post_title: T200s for sale  (help feed my habit!)
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Joe D.
"Joe,
What about NY Nationals? That is also very difficult, no?"


Bob - sorry I missed your post and didn't reply earlier.



I believe you are referring to the NY Americans card.

The NY Nationals card is not difficult at all.


In my opinion - based on my own collecting experience, and based on opinions I have received from other T200 set collectors (and going by the pop reports)...

The Boston Nationals is the toughest in the set.
The NY Americans is a close second - but not quite as tough (I have heard some arguments to the contrary - so an argument can be made).

The next two toughest are the two St. Louis Cards.
The rest of the set is fairly easy to come by.

Its a great set to go for.  Good luck.

posts.post_title: T200s for sale  (help feed my habit!)

Joe,
Yes, sorry I meant NY Americans. A premature senior moment. I have one in a SGC 50. IMHO it is equally if not more difficult than your Boston Nationals. Also I do not seem to see many Chicago Cubs in nicer condition. Your take on that?
Regards,
Bob
